folder: 115th Street and Pleasant Avenue  , Manhattan, N.Y.
text:
(1)
Church of Our Lady of Mount Carmel, 447 East 115th Street adjoining the N.W. corner of Pleasant Avenue, the day before
the Feast Day of Our Lady of Mount Carmel.
This church was built here about 1885.
July 15, 1924.
L. Sperr.
(2)
Feast of Our Lady of Mount Carmel: members of the upper east side Italian colony bringing candles to the church.
July 16, 1924.
P. L. Sperr.

title: Feast of Our Lady of Mount Carmel.

text:
429-425 East 115th Street, north side, between Pleasant and First avenues. No. 227 is a two-story frame house.
1932.
J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York
Negative No. 253

(1)

and 116th Streets.
November 9, 1934,

Pleasant Avenue at S.E. corner of 115th Street, showing the refreshment stand doing a brisk business during the annual Feast of Our Lady of Mt. Carmel. (The structure is purely temporary).
This block used to contain tanks and other parts of the Standard Gas Light Company plant.
July 16, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.

Pleasant Avenue, at 115th Street, seen from clesring behind the S.E. corner of 115th Street, former site of the Standard Gas Light
Company's tanks.
at 447 East 115th Street, adjoining the buildings on thc N.W. corner, is the Church of Our Lady of Mt. Carmel, which has occupied the site since around 1880; it is an Italian Roman Catholic panish.
July 19, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.

Pleasant Avenue, north from and including 115th Street, during the
Feast of Our Lady of Mount Carmel.  July 16, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.

Pleasant Avenue, west side, from 115th to 116th Streets, showing also the S.W. and N.E. corners of 115th Street, seen from the
clearing at the S.E. corner.
July 19, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.

folder: 115th Street (East) and Pleasant Avenue, Manhattan, N.Y.
text:
Feast of Our Lady of Mt. Carmel-1939: Mobile refreshment purveyors at the Carnival grounds at Pleasant Avenue and East 115th Street. The view is eastward across the cleared site of the future Benjamin Franklin High School. Note the Triboro and Hellgate Bridges in the background.
July 16, 1939
No's. 13-14-15
P. L. Sperr
title: Feast of Our Lady of Mount Carmel.
